intro: Schoenoplectiella erecta subsp. erecta, commonly known as the upright bulrush, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to wetland environments. It typically grows in shallow water or moist soil, often found in marshes and along the edges of lakes and rivers. The plant has slender, erect stems that are often covered in fine hairs, and its leaves are narrow and grass-like. It produces small, clustered spikelets that contain both male and female flowers, typical of the Cyperaceae family. This species plays an important ecological role in stabilizing wetland soils and providing habitat for various aquatic and terrestrial organisms.
